channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Build Your Summer Manifesto
item.description:
The warm weather months offer a unique opportunity to get some special things done, whether it's spending some time outside, firing up the grill, taking the kids out to play, or taking a trip to the beach. Sure, it'd be easy to just sit in the air conditioning and play video games when you're not working, life—like summer—is all too short. What would you like to accomplish before the weather turns cold?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: You Don’t Have to Start Big, You Just Have to Start
item.description:
When you have a big task ahead you, getting started is the toughest part. Henrik Edberg of The Positivity Blog suggests you stop thinking about how you should start and just start.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Open a Beer Bottle With a Spoon
item.description:
If you're out camping and you forgot your bottle opener, reach for your spoon. Weblog Food52 shows us how to use one to open a tasty brew.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Properly Remove a Tick with this Illustrated Guide
item.description:
One of the more dangerous summertime bugs is the tick, but fear not, The Art of Manliness has a handy illustrated guide to help you properly remove the blood-sucking pest.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: AirGif Manages Your GIF Collection, Shares It with Other Users
item.description:
Mac: There are so many good GIFs out in the world that it's hard to keep track of them all. If you prefer local storage for your favorites, AirGif organizes your collection for you. It also shares it with other uses to create a massive GIF library.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Focus on the Skills You Have Instead of Following Your Passion
item.description:
"Follow your passion," might be common career guidance, but is it good advice? Success can also come from refining the skills that you already possess, rather than worrying if your job is right for you.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Sebastian Klein

item.title: How Did You Get Over the Most Embarrassing Moment of Your Life?
item.description:
We all do stupid, embarrassing things. Thankfully, those moments tend to be learning experiences. We want to hear all about yours.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Tweetbot Adds Multiple Image Support, Better Video Support, and More
item.description:
iPhone: Tweetbot, our favorite Twitter client for the iPhone , was updated with a handful of new features, including the ability to post multiple pictures at once, a new indicator for Instagram videos, and more.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Forcing Kids to Read Is Like Forcing Them to Eat Broccoli
item.description:
We all know "reading is fundamental," but there are good ways to encourage kids to read...and ones that suck the pleasure out of reading for them.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: This Week's Most Popular Posts: June 6th to 13th
item.description:
This week we learned about hidden job interview tests , saved money at Costco , debunked some alcohol myths , and streamed the first World Cup matches . Here's a look back.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Preheat the Pan Before Roasting Vegetables
item.description:
Even the worst vegetables (I'm talking to you, cauliflower) come out amazing when they're roasted. One mistake people make when roasting vegetables, though, is starting them in a cold pan instead of preheating the pan first.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Your Name Could Influence How Believable People Think You Are
item.description:
What's in a name? Turns out, more than you might think. Just as your last name could influence your decision making , how pronounceable your name is to others could affect their view of you. Specifically, one study finds people tend to most trust those with easily pronounced names.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: ​"System" Tells You Everything You Need to Know About Your Chromebook
item.description:
Chrome: It's easy to check out the specs of your PC or Mac, but it's a different story for Chromebook owners. System is a Chrome app that provides a breakdown of your hardware.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Deals: Bluetooth Everything, 25% off Beats Music, Hybrid Storage, Roku
item.description:
This Bluetooth speaker from Philips is bigger and louder than any Jambox clone, and includes a USB charging port and built-in battery as well. $120 is the lowest price we've ever seen. [Philips Fidelio Bluetooth Speaker, $120]

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: How Do I Persuade Someone to Seek Professional Help?
item.description:
Dear Lifehacker,
I have a friend who who seems to have some issues that'd benefit from seeing a mental health professional. How can I tell him this without being a jerk?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: ​Stringnote Saves Photos and Video to Evernote With a Double Tap
item.description:
Android: When you want to record something to Evernote, speed can be of the essence. Stringnote turns your phone's power button into a handy note-taking shortcut.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Learn to Drill Steel Like a Pro for Better DIY Projects
item.description:
If you need to drill holes into steel or other metals, you run the risk of damaging your drill bits or work material. Ask The Builder has some tips to help you get it right.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mark Wilson

item.title: Talk About Soccerball in Friday's Copa Mundial Thread
item.description:
Hello! Welcome to the Friday open thread, where one can ask such questions as, "Am I still alive?" and "Why?" and receive tips about how to use an Arduino to wash your laundry in return.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Liveschedules on Hackerspace, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: All the Awesome Stuff You Can Do with Google+ Photos
item.description:
Even if you don't use Google+ for its social aspects, you might want to use the service for its stellar photo capabilities alone. From unlimited photos storage to automatic enhancements and robust photo editing tools, here are the things you can do with your photos on Google+ that you might be missing out on.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Google Now Adds "Inferred Events," Suggests Calendar Events From Email
item.description:
Google Now just keeps getting smarter. As Android Police reports, Google has started offering to add events to your Calender by way of Google Now, based on your Gmail conversations if you talk to someone else about something that sounds like an event.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Fitbay Helps You Find Clothes that Fit Your Body Type Online
item.description:
One of the biggest problems with shopping for clothes online is that you can't try them on to see if they fit. Fitbay aims to alleviate this problem by only showing you clothes that are available in your size and fit.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Camera ZOOM FX, our Favorite Android Camera App, Goes Free(mium)
item.description:
Android: Camera ZOOM FX, our pick for the best Android camera app , shed its $3 price tag today, and is going free(mium). The free version comes with some of the app's best features, and the new "pro" version retains everything that made the original great.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Save Money and Become Happier by Simply Wanting Less Stuff
item.description:
Sometimes the best solutions are the simple ones that are staring you right in the face. You could scrimp and save, you can reduce your expenses, you can create elaborate budgets and those are all good. But if you really want to save money, one killer trick can do tons of good: want less stuff.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Gawker The Non Sports Fan's Guide to Sounding Informed About the World Cup | Jalopnik Ten Best Car D
item.description:
Gawker The Non Sports Fan's Guide to Sounding Informed About the World Cup | Jalopnik Ten Best Car Destruction Videos | Jezebel Bill Murray Crashes Couple's Engagement Photo Shoot | Kotaku People Say Aaron Paul Is Turning on Their Xbox Ones

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on io9, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: Short Term Sacrifices Lead to Long Term Financial Health
item.description:
Over at Get Rich Slowly, J.D. Roth shares a story of a reader who approached him asking what to do if you're broke, but couldn't suffer the idea of a side-job. The whole affair is a reminder that if you're looking to dig out of debt or save for the future, you have to make some sacrifices to get to those goals.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry
